trans-unit.source: Connecting to SQL Database: Links, Best Practices and Design Guidelines
trans-unit.target: Connecting to SQL Database: Links, Best Practices and Design Guidelines

trans-unit.source: A starting point topic that gathers together links and recommendations for client programs that connect to Azure SQL Database from technologies such as ADO.NET and PHP.
trans-unit.target: A starting point topic that gathers together links and recommendations for client programs that connect to Azure SQL Database from technologies such as ADO.NET and PHP.

trans-unit.source: Connecting to SQL Database: Links, Best Practices and Design Guidelines
trans-unit.target: Connecting to SQL Database: Links, Best Practices and Design Guidelines

trans-unit.source: This topic is a good place to get started with client connectivity to Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: This topic is a good place to get started with client connectivity to Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: It provides links to code samples for various technologies that you can use to connect to and interact with SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: It provides links to code samples for various technologies that you can use to connect to and interact with SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: The technologies include Enterprise Library, JDBC, PHP, and several more.
trans-unit.target: The technologies include Enterprise Library, JDBC, PHP, and several more.

trans-unit.source: The information provided applies regardless of which specific technology you use to connect to SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The information provided applies regardless of which specific technology you use to connect to SQL Database.

trans-unit.target: Technology-independent recommendations

trans-unit.target: [Guidelines for Connecting to Azure SQL Database Programmatically](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee336282.aspx) - discussions include the following:

trans-unit.target: Throttling

trans-unit.source: Authentication recommendations
trans-unit.target: Authentication recommendations

trans-unit.source: Use Azure SQL Database authentication, not Windows authentication which is not available in Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure SQL Database authentication, not Windows authentication which is not available in Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Specify a particular database, instead of defaulting to the *master* database.
trans-unit.target: Specify a particular database, instead of defaulting to the *master* database.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use the Transact-SQL **USE myDatabaseName;** statement on SQL Database to switch to another database.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use the Transact-SQL **USE myDatabaseName;** statement on SQL Database to switch to another database.

trans-unit.source: Contained users
trans-unit.target: Contained users

trans-unit.source: You have choices when adding a person as a user to your SQL Database:
trans-unit.target: You have choices when adding a person as a user to your SQL Database:

trans-unit.source: Add a *login* with a password to the **master** database, and then add a corresponding *user* to one or more other databases on the same server.
trans-unit.target: Add a *login* with a password to the **master** database, and then add a corresponding *user* to one or more other databases on the same server.

trans-unit.source: Add a *contained user* with a password to one or more databases, and no link to any *login* in **master**.
trans-unit.target: Add a *contained user* with a password to one or more databases, and no link to any *login* in **master**.

trans-unit.source: The contained user approach has advantages and disadvantages:
trans-unit.target: The contained user approach has advantages and disadvantages:

trans-unit.source: Advantage is that a database can easily be moved from one Azure SQL Database server to another, when all users in the database are contained users.
trans-unit.target: Advantage is that a database can easily be moved from one Azure SQL Database server to another, when all users in the database are contained users.

trans-unit.source: Disadvantage is the greater difficulty in routine administration.
trans-unit.target: Disadvantage is the greater difficulty in routine administration.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: It is more challenging to drop several contained users than it is to drop one login.
trans-unit.target: It is more challenging to drop several contained users than it is to drop one login.

trans-unit.source: A person who is a contained user in several databases might have more passwords to remember or update.
trans-unit.target: A person who is a contained user in several databases might have more passwords to remember or update.

trans-unit.source: Further information is given in - [Contained Databases](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff929071.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Further information is given in - [Contained Databases](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff929071.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Connection recommendations
trans-unit.target: Connection recommendations

trans-unit.source: In your client connection logic, override the default timeout to be 30 seconds.
trans-unit.target: In your client connection logic, override the default timeout to be 30 seconds.

trans-unit.source: The default of 15 seconds is too short for connections that depend on the internet.
trans-unit.target: The default of 15 seconds is too short for connections that depend on the internet.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your [Azure SQL Database firewall](sql-database-firewall-configure.md) allows outgoing TCP communication on port 1433.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your [Azure SQL Database firewall](sql-database-firewall-configure.md) allows outgoing TCP communication on port 1433.

trans-unit.source: You can configure the firewall settings on an SQL Database server or to an individual database.
trans-unit.target: You can configure the firewall settings on an SQL Database server or to an individual database.

trans-unit.source: To handle *transient faults*, add [*retry* logic](#TransientFaultsAndRetryLogicGm) to your client programs that interact with Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: To handle *transient faults*, add [*retry* logic](#TransientFaultsAndRetryLogicGm) to your client programs that interact with Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Connection pool
trans-unit.target: Connection pool

trans-unit.source: If you are using a [connection pool](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8xx3tyca.aspx), close the connection the instant your program is not actively using it, and is not preparing to reuse it.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a [connection pool](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8xx3tyca.aspx), close the connection the instant your program is not actively using it, and is not preparing to reuse it.

trans-unit.source: Unless your program will reuse the connection for another operation immediately and without pause, we recommend the following pattern:
trans-unit.target: Unless your program will reuse the connection for another operation immediately and without pause, we recommend the following pattern:

trans-unit.source: Open a connection.
trans-unit.target: Open a connection.

trans-unit.source: Do one operation through the connection.
trans-unit.target: Do one operation through the connection.

trans-unit.source: Close the connection.
trans-unit.target: Close the connection.

trans-unit.source: Exception thrown when using a pool
trans-unit.target: Exception thrown when using a pool

trans-unit.source: When connection pooling is enabled, and a timeout error or other login error occurs, an exception will be thrown.
trans-unit.target: When connection pooling is enabled, and a timeout error or other login error occurs, an exception will be thrown.

trans-unit.source: Subsequent connection attempts will fail for the next 5 seconds, which is called a *blocking period*.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent connection attempts will fail for the next 5 seconds, which is called a *blocking period*.

trans-unit.source: If the application attempts to connect within the blocking period, the first exception will be thrown again.
trans-unit.target: If the application attempts to connect within the blocking period, the first exception will be thrown again.

trans-unit.source: After the blocking period ends, subsequent failures result in a new blocking period that lasts twice as long as the previous blocking period.
trans-unit.target: After the blocking period ends, subsequent failures result in a new blocking period that lasts twice as long as the previous blocking period.

trans-unit.source: The maximum duration of a blocking period is 60 seconds.
trans-unit.target: The maximum duration of a blocking period is 60 seconds.

trans-unit.source: Ports other than just 1433 in V12
trans-unit.target: Ports other than just 1433 in V12

trans-unit.source: Client connections to Azure SQL Database V12 sometimes bypass the proxy and interact directly with the database.
trans-unit.target: Client connections to Azure SQL Database V12 sometimes bypass the proxy and interact directly with the database.

trans-unit.source: Ports other than 1433 become important.
trans-unit.target: Ports other than 1433 become important.

trans-unit.source: For details see:
trans-unit.target: For details see:

trans-unit.source: [Ports beyond 1433 for ADO.NET 4.5 and SQL Database V12](sql-database-develop-direct-route-ports-adonet-v12.md)
trans-unit.target: [Ports beyond 1433 for ADO.NET 4.5 and SQL Database V12](sql-database-develop-direct-route-ports-adonet-v12.md)

trans-unit.source: The next section has more to say about retry logic and transient fault handling.
trans-unit.target: The next section has more to say about retry logic and transient fault handling.

trans-unit.source: Transient faults and retry logic
trans-unit.target: Transient faults and retry logic

trans-unit.source: The Azure system has the ability to dynamically reconfigure servers when heavy workloads arise in the SQL Database service.
trans-unit.target: The Azure system has the ability to dynamically reconfigure servers when heavy workloads arise in the SQL Database service.

trans-unit.source: However, a reconfiguration might cause your client program to lose its connection to SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: However, a reconfiguration might cause your client program to lose its connection to SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: This error is called a *transient fault*.
trans-unit.target: This error is called a *transient fault*.

trans-unit.source: Your client program can try to reestablish a connection after waiting for perhaps 6 to 60 seconds between retries.
trans-unit.target: Your client program can try to reestablish a connection after waiting for perhaps 6 to 60 seconds between retries.

trans-unit.source: You must provide the retry logic in your client.
trans-unit.target: You must provide the retry logic in your client.

trans-unit.source: For code samples that illustrate retry logic, see:
trans-unit.target: For code samples that illustrate retry logic, see:

trans-unit.source: Client quick-start code samples to SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Client quick-start code samples to SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Error numbers for transient faults
trans-unit.target: Error numbers for transient faults

trans-unit.source: When any error occurs with SQL Database, an [SqlException](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.data.sqlclient.sqlexception.aspx) is thrown.
trans-unit.target: When any error occurs with SQL Database, an [SqlException](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.data.sqlclient.sqlexception.aspx) is thrown.

trans-unit.source: The **SqlException** contains a numeric error code in its **Number** property.
trans-unit.target: The **SqlException** contains a numeric error code in its **Number** property.

trans-unit.source: If the error code identifies a transient error, your program should retry the call.
trans-unit.target: If the error code identifies a transient error, your program should retry the call.

trans-unit.source: Error messages for SQL Database client programs
trans-unit.target: Error messages for SQL Database client programs

trans-unit.source: Its **Transient Errors, Connection-Loss Errors** section is a list of the transient errors that warrant an automatic retry.
trans-unit.target: Its **Transient Errors, Connection-Loss Errors** section is a list of the transient errors that warrant an automatic retry.

trans-unit.source: For example, retry if the error number 40613 occurs, which says something similar to
trans-unit.target: For example, retry if the error number 40613 occurs, which says something similar to

trans-unit.source: Database 'mydatabase' on server 'theserver' is not currently available.
trans-unit.target: Database 'mydatabase' on server 'theserver' is not currently available.

trans-unit.source: For further information see:
trans-unit.target: For further information see:

trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database Development: How-to Topics

trans-unit.source: Technologies
trans-unit.target: Technologies

trans-unit.source: The following topics contains links to code samples for several languages and driver technologies that you can use to connect to Azure SQL Database from your client program.
trans-unit.target: The following topics contains links to code samples for several languages and driver technologies that you can use to connect to Azure SQL Database from your client program.

trans-unit.source: Various code samples are given for clients that run on both Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X.
trans-unit.target: Various code samples are given for clients that run on both Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X.

trans-unit.source: **General samples:** There are [code samples](sql-database-develop-quick-start-client-code-samples.md) for a variety of programming languages, including PHP, Python, Node.js, and .NET CSharp.
trans-unit.target: **General samples:** There are [code samples](sql-database-develop-quick-start-client-code-samples.md) for a variety of programming languages, including PHP, Python, Node.js, and .NET CSharp.

trans-unit.source: Also, samples are given for clients that run on Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X.
trans-unit.target: Also, samples are given for clients that run on Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X.
